headline.main: SWILL-MILK.; Interesting Facts, and Conclusion. The Board of Health's Committee Visits Two Establishments. THE STABLES HALF-EMPTY AND WHITEWASHED

docs.abstract: Committee of the Board of Health visits 2 Stables
docs.lead_paragraph: Aldermen TUOMEY, TUCKER and REED, and Councilmen HASWELL and CROSS, the Committee of the Board of Health appointed to investigate the complaints and report the facts concerning the swill milk business in this City, yesterday visited the distilleries and cow pens of WM. M. JOHNSON'S SONS, in Sixteenth-street, and of Mr. GEORGE MOORE, in Thirty-ninth street. At 10 1/2 o'clock, A.M., the Committee

docs.snippet: The Cunard steamship Africa, from Liverpool on the 15th inst., arrived at this port yesterday morning, bringing three days' later intelligence from Europe. In the House of Lords, on the 14th, Lord SHAFTESBURY moved his resolutions of censure upon the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Cunard steamship Africa, from Liverpool on the 15th inst., arrived at this port yesterday morning, bringing three days' later intelligence from Europe. In the House of Lords, on the 14th, Lord SHAFTESBURY moved his resolutions of censure upon the Government for their dispatch to the Governor-General of India, touching his proclamation to the people of Oude.

docs.snippet: The swill-milk establishments having been whitewashed, their hopelessly-diseased cows having been slaughtered and sent to market, and about half the rest of their live stock sent out to graze, the Committee of the Board of Health yesterday made their...
docs.lead_paragraph: The swill-milk establishments having been whitewashed, their hopelessly-diseased cows having been slaughtered and sent to market, and about half the rest of their live stock sent out to graze, the Committee of the Board of Health yesterday made their first visit to such of them as they were invited to inspect.

docs.snippet: A regular meeting of the City Teachers' Association was held yesterday at 4 o'clock P. M, in the Hall of the Board of Education. W. W. SMITH, Esq., Presiden't, in the chair. The minutes were read by the Secretary, and the Essayist not being present,...
docs.lead_paragraph: A regular meeting of the City Teachers' Association was held yesterday at 4 o'clock P. M, in the Hall of the Board of Education. W. W. SMITH, Esq., Presiden't, in the chair. The minutes were read by the Secretary, and the Essayist not being present, the President requested Mr. H. L. STUART to give a resume of the positions of his address delivered at the April meeting, in order to

headline.main: Profitable Partriotism--The United States Steamer Antelope and Commodore Armstrong.

docs.snippet: In the Senate, yesterday, the morning hour was principally occupiedin a discussion of the Chicago Harbor Improvement bill, but without any result. The Fifteen Million Loan bill was then debated until 6 o'clock in the evening, but no action was taken....
docs.lead_paragraph: In the Senate, yesterday, the morning hour was principally occupiedin a discussion of the Chicago Harbor Improvement bill, but without any result. The Fifteen Million Loan bill was then debated until 6 o'clock in the evening, but no action was taken. In the House of Representatives, Mr. GRow failed in an effort to introduce a resolution that the next session commence on the 4th of November.

headline.main: MASSACHUSETTS.; Movements of Liquor-Dealers--Col. Lincoln--the Turks--Reopening of the Boston Theatre--Tuckerman's Egotism--Mr. Summer--Mr. Herberr, &c., &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Several hundred of our liquor-dealers had a meeting on the evening of the 20th, and talked strongly about Judge SHAW's decision. They mean to carry up the matter to the federal tribunals, and, failing there, to resort to the Dallot box. At the polls they will be most tremendously" licked." They acted so foolishly after the law of 1852 was passed, that no political party, as such, has any sympathy with them;

headline.main: Important Change in the Duties of the Inspecter of Vessels.
